org.ejml.alg.dense.misc
Class UtilDeterminant

java.lang.Object
  org.ejml.alg.dense.misc.UtilDeterminant

public class UtilDeterminant
extends java.lang.Object

The determinant of a matrix is a "special" number associated with square matrices. It has many uses in linear algebra. Using minor matrices it can be defined as follows:

|A| = Sum{ i=1:k ; aij Cij }

Cij = (-1)i+j Mij

Where M_ij is the minor of matrix A formed by eliminating row i and column j from A. This process is called determinant expansion by minors (or "Laplacian expansion by minors").

Definition from http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Determinant.html Aug 3, 2009.

Author:
Peter Abeles

det4by4

public static double det4by4(double[] mat)
Computes the determinant of a 4 by 4 matrix using same algorithm as DeterminantFromMinor but where everything has been unrolled and is much faster.

Parameters:
mat - A row major 4 by 4 matrix.
Returns:
The determinant of the matrix

detRecursive

public static double detRecursive(DenseMatrix64F mat)

A simple and inefficient algorithm for computing the determinant. This should never be used. It is at least two orders of magnitude slower than DeterminantFromMinor. This is included to provide a point of comparision for other algorithms.

Parameters:
mat - The matrix that the determinant is to be computed from
Returns:
The determinant.
